text: I have a great idea for you for a mega
head slide for Thanksgiving always
looking for ways to get ahead when I
have a big day of cooking ahead of me so
today I'm making twice baked potatoes
they can be completely prepped ahead of
time and then popped into the oven like
say while your turkey is resting you put
this in the oven to bake and then you
can serve it up just in time for dinner
I'm rubbing these with oil I have two
and a half pounds of kind of small
potatoes you don't want to overdo the
size of your potato when it's just going
to be a side dish for a big meal like
Thanksgiving so rub them with a little
oil have your oven preheating to 400
degrees and then get these oil rubbed
potatoes into the oven to bake until
they're very tender that should take
about 45 minutes when the potatoes have
cooled off a little bit you can continue
with your recipe just slice a little bit
off the top of each potato about I don't
know an eighth of the top of the potato
I guess just a small piece you don't
want to get rid of too much potato
because well that's what you're eating
right so just slice a little bit off
making a little vessel to hold the
potato and some other yummy ingredients
when I was in high school I had a job at
this health food store and we used to
make twice baked potatoes with pieces of
tofu in there and was like a full meal
not gonna make you put tofu into your
Thanksgiving side dish but you ever want
to give it a try it was really yummy you
can just get rid of these or if you
wanted to you could toss them with a
little oil and keep them on the pan
while you were baking them twice and
they might get a little bit crispy now
what you want to do is scoop out most of
the inside of the potato but you want to
leave a shell that's sturdy enough to
hold the potato so leave about a quarter
of an inch of potato around the outside
and then hollow out the rest you can
just transfer your potato into a large
bowl because you're going to mash it
with some sour cream and milk and butter
and all that stuff you can do this the
day before Thanksgiving if you want to
you can get everything all ready keep
them in two in a container in your
refrigerator and then take them out when
you're ready to bake them to the
potatoes add a quarter cup of milk a cup
of sour cream delicious and rich just
remember it's Thanksgiving anything
we insist insist they suppose you could
use low-fat sour cream but that's not my
fave three tablespoons of unsalted
butter and then mash everything together
the fillings gonna be a little bit
looser than you would expect from like
mashed potatoes or something like that
but it'll firm up as it bakes inside the
potato make these nice and tasty season
them with salt and pepper about 1/4 cup
of chives if your knife is nice and
sharp you can definitely do this with a
knife or you can use a pair of scissors
I just prefer to use my knife but a dull
knife won't chopped herbs very nicely if
I was going to be making this ahead I
might not add my chives I might mix my
potato mixture scoop out my potatoes and
then keep the chives on the side until
today I was going to bake them because I
feel like onion flavors like chive grow
and increase in flavor as they sit and I
like the mildness of it but I wouldn't
want it to become overpowering add your
chives to the potato mixture
give it a stir kind of just want to eat
with a spoon right now but I'm not gonna
I'm gonna put it in my potatoes and I'm
going to wait until Thanksgiving when
you fill these back up they'll be
mounding slightly which is a beautiful
presentation instead of tribal if you
wanted you don't like that oniony flavor
you can use parsley a little bit of
tarragon would be nice have your oven
preheating to 400 degrees and bake these
until they're golden brown on top and
heated through that'll take about 20
minutes if they haven't been
refrigerated if they were refrigerated
might take a little bit longer and you
should check off your awhile let's say
like after that 20 minutes and see if it
needs to be tented with foil if it's
darkening too quickly they are done
golden brown on top festive I think you
definitely don't have to just have this
for Thanksgiving they're great I'm going
to eat one mmm
a little bit of time from the sour cream
a little bit of mild onion flavor from

a great make head side
